SEARCH
Package tempest_foundation

Class BracketManager

java.lang.Object
tempest_foundation.BracketManager
public class BracketManager extends Object
The BracketManager class provides utility methods for managing and analyzing bracket-like characters (e.g., angle brackets, square brackets) in a given string.

This class includes methods to count bracket occurrences for the purpose of being able pare out variables.

Author:
Jared De Four

  • Method Details

    • bracketCounter

      public static int bracketCounter(String line, char[] chars)
      Counts the balance of bracket-like characters in a given string based on their specified types.

      This method iterates over the characters specified in the 'chars' array, incrementing or decrementing the count based on the type of bracker. If the bracket is a left bracket the count is increased. If the type is a right bracket the count is decreased

      Parameters:
      line - the string in which bracket-like characters will be counted.
      chars - a line, potentially wth brackets to be counted.
      Returns:
      the final count of brakets, if the final count is 0 the brackets are balanced and correct.

    • bracketLastIndex

      public static char bracketLastIndex(String str)
      Identifies the last bracket-like character in a given string based on the types of angle brackets and square brackets.

      This method compares the last indices of and in the string and returns the character that occurs last. If both characters appear at the same position, it returns '*' to indicate no clear last character.

      Parameters:
      str - the string in which the last bracket-like character is to be identified.
      Returns:
      the last occurring bracket-like character, either '>' or ']', or '*' if neither is dominant.
